beschrijving.en-x-generated:
To be approved as a fire protection equipment technician , you must meet:

  • general recognition conditions that apply to all environmental recognitions:
    • in the 3 years preceding the application for the Flemish certificate of recognition, the applicant has not been convicted in a Member State of the European Economic Area for breaches of environmental legislation relating to the use of the recognition
    • in the 2 years preceding the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, no recognition with the same object has been withdrawn from the applicant, for violation of the related obligations of that recognition.
  • special conditions of recognition:
    • be a natural person
    • hold a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician (certificate of competence)

You already have a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician

If you already have a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician, you can also obtain the Flemish recognition certificate. However, you must register with the Flemish authorities before you start working in the Flemish Region. This obligation applies to technicians who:

  • obtained a European certificate outside the Flemish Region
  • have obtained a European certificate in the Flemish Region, but do not yet have a Flemish recognition certificate.

Period of validity and obligations

Recognition is valid for an indefinite period. However, as a recognised technician, you must fulfil certain obligations.

More info on the obligations for recognised technicians for fire protection equipment.

The company for which the technician works must also have an approval as a company for fire protection equipment.

  • algemene erkenningsvoorwaarden die gelden voor alle erkenningen leefmilieu:

Heb je al een Europees certificaat als technicus voor brandbeveiligingsapparatuur, dan kan je ook het Vlaamse erkenningsbewijs krijgen. Je moet je wel aanmelden bij de Vlaamse overheid vóór je begint te werken in het Vlaamse Gewest. Die verplichting geldt voor technici die:

  • buiten het Vlaamse Gewest een Europees certificaat behaald hebben
  • in het Vlaamse Gewest een Europees certificaat behaald hebben, maar nog geen Vlaams erkenningsbewijs hebben.

Geldigheidsduur en verplichtingen

De erkenning is geldig voor onbepaalde duur. Als erkend technicus moet je wel voldoen aan enkele verplichtingen.

beschrijving.en:
To be recognised as a fire protection equipment technician, you must fulfil:

  • general recognition conditions that apply to all recognitions relating to the environment
    • in the 3 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, the applicant has not been convicted of a criminal offence in a member state of the European Economic Area, for infringements of the environmental legislation concerning the use of the recognition.
    • in the 2 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, no recognition with the same object was revoked due to infringement of the obligations associated with that recognition.
  • special recognition conditions:
    • be a natural person
    • hold a European certificate as fire protection equipment technician (certificate of competence) issued by a recognised training centre after you have passed the associated examination.

If you already hold a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician

If you already hold a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician, you can also obtain Flemish recognition. You must register with the Flemish administration before starting to work in the Flemish Region. This requirement applies to technicians who:

  • have obtained a European certificate outside the Flemish Region
  • have obtained a European certificate in the Flemish Region, but do not have a Flemish recognition certificate.

Validity period and obligations

The recognition is valid for an indefinite period. As a recognised technician, you must meet the following obligations among others to retain your recognition:

  • fully and correctly complete the installation-linked logbook
  • on request, show the tools that will be used to perform the tasks
  • hold insurance for third-party liability, including professional liability, in connection with the use of the recognition
  • report every change of identification data (such as address, e-mail address) immediately via erkenningen.omgeving@vlaanderen.be
  • pay the annual fee for the supervision of the recognition. The first payment is to be made in the year following the year in which you obtained the Flemish recognition certificate. Failure to pay the annual fee will lead to automatic suspension of the recognition following a formal notice of default. If the fee is not paid within 30 days of the suspension, the recognition will automatically lapse.

beschrijving.en:
If you do not yet have a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician

Anyone wishing to work as a technician for fire protection equipment in the Flemish Region, and who does not yet hold a European certificate, must pass an examination at a recognised training centre. Download the overview list of recognised training centres.

Those who pass the examination receive a European certificate (certificate of competence) and a Flemish recognition certificate.

If you already hold a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician

If you have obtained the European certificate but not yet the Flemish recognition, you must register via the online recognition counter of the Department of Environment and Spatial Development (click on “Ga naar het erkenningenloket”; log in with eID).

If you do not have a Belgian eID, you should submit your application by registered letter to Departement Omgeving, Koning Albert II-laan 20/bus 8, 1000 Brussel, to the attention of Team Erkenningen, Afdeling GOP.

Attach the following data to your notification:

  • a copy of the European certificate in Dutch, French, German or English
  • the identification details of the technician:
    • first and last name
    • the national register number, or if the technician does not have a national register number: date and place of birth, home address and date from which the technician has resided at that address
    • the telephone number and the e-mail address of the technician
    • the name and the company registration number of the company where the technician works. If the company does not have a registration number, you should submit the address of the head office and the company VAT number.

STEP 1: Obtain a European certificate

Anyone who wants to work as a fire protection equipment technician in the Flemish Region and does not yet have a European certificate must take an exam at a recognised training centre. The exam consists of a theory and practical part. The content of the theory and practical examination is laid down in annex to regulation 304/2008.

Download the list of recognised training centres for fire protection equipment technicians here.

Those who pass the exam receive a European certificate (certificate of competence). The training institute also registers your certificate in the Database of Qualifications and Professional Experience Attestations (LED) of the Flemish government.

STEP 2: Register for recognition as a fire protection equipment technician via the self-management counter 'My VLAREL recognition'.

  • You need to register with your eID at the counter. Without registration, you cannot start working as a fire protection equipment technician.
  • As soon as you have obtained a European certificate and registered , you will receive an e-mail with your recognition number and further info.

You already have a European certificate as a fire protection equipment technician

STEP 1: Register for recognition as a fire protection equipment technician via the self-management counter 'My VLAREL recognition'.

STEP 2: Provide a copy of your European certificate in Dutch, French, German or English via a notification of the use of a recognition in the recognition counter Omgeving (click on 'Go to the recognition counter'; register with eID).

If you do not have a Belgian eID, you must send your notification by registered letter to the Department of Environment, Koning Albert II-laan 20/bus 8, 1000 Brussels, for the attention of the GOP department.

beschrijving.en:
To be recognised as a fuel oil tank technician, you must fulfil:

  • general recognition conditions that apply to all recognitions relating to the environment
    • in the 3 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, the applicant has not been convicted of a criminal offence in a member state of the European Economic Area, for infringements of the environmental legislation concerning the use of the recognition.
    • in the 2 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, no recognition with the same object was revoked due to infringement of the obligations associated with that recognition.
  • special recognition conditions:
    • be a natural person
    • have a certificate of competence for the control and maintenance of fuel oil tanks. That certificate must have been awarded by a recognised training centre.

Validity period and obligations

The recognition is valid for an indefinite period. As a recognised technician, you must meet the following obligations among others to retain your recognition:

  • hold insurance for third-party liability, including professional liability, in connection with the use of the recognition
  • every 5 years, follow a refresher training at a recognised training centre. The latest date for following a refresher training can be found at:
    • on your certificate of competence
    • or in the overview lists of recognised fuel oil tank technicians.
  • report every change of identification data (such as address, e-mail address) immediately via erkenningen.omgeving@vlaanderen.be
  • pay the annual fee for the supervision of the recognition. The first payment is to be made in the year following the year in which you obtained the Flemish recognition certificate. Failure to pay the annual fee will lead to automatic suspension of the recognition following a formal notice of default. If the fee is still not paid within 30 days of the suspension, the recognition will automatically lapse.

More info on the obligations for recognised technicians can be found on the Department of Environment and Spatial Development website.

  • attend the lessons to a sufficient extent
  • and/or participate in the final assessment, if that is provided.

beschrijving.nl-BE-x-formal:
Stagiair

De stagiair kan op vrijwillige basis een betaalde stage doen in een bedrijf. Zo scherpt hij zijn vaardigheden en competenties aan op de werkvloer.

Elke werkzoekende, werknemer, zelfstandige, student of buitenlander die in België mag werken, kan een BIS doen. Zo kan hij extra vaardigheden en competenties verwerven op de werkvloer.

U kunt geen beroepsinlevingsstage (BIS) afsluiten

  • voor opleidingen die plaatsvinden in het kader van een lopende arbeidsovereenkomst.
  • voor arbeidsprestaties in het kader van een opleiding die u volgt.
  • voor stages die voorbereiden op de uitoefening van een vrij beroep.
  • voor verplichte stages die leiden tot het behalen van een diploma of getuigschrift
  • voor beschermde beroepstitels als u niet in het bezit bent van de vereiste beroepskwalificatie.

Werkgever

De werkgever betaalt geen loon of RSZ, alleen een stagevergoeding voor elke gepresteerde arbeidsdag. Na de BIS mag hij de stagiair aanwerven, maar dat is geen verplichting.

Elke werkgever uit de profit- en de nonprofitsector kan een beroepsinlevingsovereenkomst afsluiten.

De stagiair kan op vrijwillige basis een betaalde stage doen in een bedrijf. Zo scherpt hij zijn vaardigheden en competenties aan op de werkvloer.

Elke werkzoekende, werknemer, zelfstandige, student of buitenlander die in België mag werken, kan een BIS doen. Zo kan hij extra vaardigheden en competenties verwerven op de werkvloer.

U kunt geen beroepsinlevingsstage (BIS) afsluiten

  • voor opleidingen die plaatsvinden in het kader van een lopende arbeidsovereenkomst.
  • voor arbeidsprestaties in het kader van een opleiding die u volgt.
  • voor stages die voorbereiden op de uitoefening van een vrij beroep.
  • voor verplichte stages die leiden tot het behalen van een diploma of getuigschrift

Wat doet een gemeenschapsinstelling?

In een gemeenschapsinstelling zorgen begeleiders, leerkrachten, psychologen en maatschappelijk werkers voor een goede pedagogische begeleiding. Daarnaast is er een specifiek aanbod in functie van de concrete hulpvraag van elke jongere, rekening houdend met de mogelijkheden van de instelling. Dat betekent dat de gemeenschapsinstellingen de hulp bieden die de jongere nodig heeft. Samen met de jongere, ouders, consulent en jeugdrechter zoeken ze uit hoe de jongere het best wordt geholpen.

In de gemeenschapsinstellingen zijn er open en gesloten afdelingen. Of de jongere nu in een open of een gesloten afdeling terecht komt, het dagelijkse leven speelt zich vooral af binnen de muren van de instelling. In een gesloten afdeling zijn de regels en het toezicht wel strenger dan in een open afdeling.

  • en gemeenschapsinstelling De Grubbe in Everberg

  • een ‘blijvende verwijderingspremie’ omdat je kansen op het vinden van werk kunnen verminderen. Als je blijvend arbeidsongeschikt bent, dan wordt in de praktijk je graad van blijvend arbeidsongeschiktheid verhoogd met deze rente.

The reference quarter salary is the gross salary that said employee earns when they work full-time and continuously during one quarter.
  • If the employee did not work full-time in a particular quarter, for example because they entered into employment in the middle of a quarter, or in the event of part-time work or long-term illness, the amount of the reduction will be adjusted.

The company or establishment where the newly recruited young person works must be located in the Flemish Region.

As an entrepreneur, you can receive the NSSO reduction if the young person:

  • is aged under 25: the young person must not turn 25 during the quarter in which they start working for you
  • and does not have a higher education diploma and is therefore low-qualified.

As an entrepreneur, you can only receive the NSSO reduction if the reference quarter salary of the young person you hire remains below a certain limit. The reference quarter salary is the gross salary that the young person earns when they work full-time and continuously during one quarter.

  • In the first year the reference quarter salary amounts to EUR 7,500.
    In the second year it amounts to EUR 8,100. The maximum limit is higher in the second year, so that a hard-working young person can still be rewarded.
  • The reference quarter salary may vary from quarter to quarter, which means that an employer may not receive a reduction in one specific quarter but will receive one in the next.
    If the newly hired young person did not work full-time in a certain quarter, for example when entering into employment in the middle of a quarter, or in the event of part-time work or long-term illness, the amount of the reduction will be adjusted.

The young person must have created a career portfolio with accurate information on their studies via 'My career' (Dutch: ‘Mijn loopbaan’) of the Flemish Service for Employment and Vocational Training (Dutch: Vlaamse Dienst voor Arbeidsbemiddeling en Beroepsopleiding/VDAB) prior to taking up employment.

To be recognised as an SR expert, you must fulfil:

  • general recognition conditions that apply to all recognitions relating to the environment
    • in the 3 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, the applicant has not been convicted of a criminal offence in a member state of the European Economic Area, for infringements of the environmental legislation concerning the use of the recognition.
    • in the 2 years that precede the application for the Flemish recognition certificate, no recognition with the same object was revoked due to infringement of the obligations associated with that recognition.
  • special recognition conditions:
    • be a natural person
    • have obtained at least a master’s or equivalent degree
      • have at least 3 years’ practical experience in contracts in the field of the recognition, during the 5 years preceding the application for recognition
    • have obtained at least a bachelor’s or equivalent degree
      • have at least 5 years’ practical experience in contracts in the field of the recognition, during the 7 years preceding the application for recognition
    • successfully completed a training course in which the subjects listed in annex 9 of the VLAREL are covered.

Validity period and obligations

The recognition is valid for an indefinite period. As a recognised SR expert, you must meet the following obligations among others to retain your recognition:

  • hold insurance for third party liability, including professional liability, in connection with the use of the recognition
  • report every change of identification data (such as address, e-mail address) immediately via erkenningen.omgeving@vlaanderen.be
  • pay the annual fee for the supervision of the recognition. The first payment is to be made in the year following the year in which you obtained the Flemish recognition certificate. Failure to pay the annual fee will lead to automatic suspension of the recognition following a formal notice of default. If the fee is still not paid within 30 days of the suspension, the recognition will automatically lapse.

More info on the obligations for recognised SR experts can be found on the Department of Environment and Spatial Development website.
